message: Let's start fair, I'll take the majority but you get a decent share.  Accept this and we both get something.
You're starting strong, but I'm not going down without a fight. Your turn to accept or reject.
I see you're playing tough, Bob.  Let's be reasonable and split it 60/40.  We both get a solid chunk, and we avoid this going on forever.
You're trying to strong-arm me, but I'm not afraid of a 60/40 split. I'll meet you halfway, but I'm not giving up yet.
Okay, Bob, you're making this tough.  Let's just split it evenly.  We're both losing value with each round, and I'm not sure how much longer this can go on.
You're trying to go for an even split, but I'm not going to give up control that easily. I'll give you a slight discount, but I'm still driving the bus.
Bob, we're getting into dangerous territory here.  I'm willing to concede a little more to avoid the risk of getting nothing at all.  Let's do 45/55, and we can both walk away with something.
You're getting desperate, Alice. I'm not afraid of the risk. I'll give you a smaller share, but I'm still taking the lead.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous.  We're both losing huge amounts of value with each round.  Let's just agree to something before it's too late. I'm willing to accept 35/65. This is my final offer.
You're trying to squeeze the last drop out of me, but I'm not going down without a fight. I'll give you a tiny bit more, but I'm still taking the majority.
Bob, this is it.  I'm desperate, but I'm not giving up.  Let's avoid getting nothing at all.  I'm proposing 25/75.  Take it or we both get nothing.
You're really trying to beg, but I'm not going to take it. I'll give you a tiny fraction, but I'm taking the lion's share. It's now or never.
